reviews.text: Unmanned station, get your ticket on the train, very small car park 6 spaces plus 1 for disabled

There's a shelter with a bench thing (which hurts me arse!), a monstrosity of a bridge (but useful enough for the disabled) and only one platform, the old platform across from the one in use is covered in weeds, thorns, etc. It makes the station look horrible!  There is also loads of crap on the tracks such as purple-pink pillows, cans of Irn-Bru and other trash. Station needs a big cleanup and bringing back the second platform would be useful! The station is busy 2 or 3 times throughout the day but there has been times where I was the only one waiting at the platform, so I don't really mind that there is no ticket office. Rare but there has been a few times where the conductor hasn't come out of his cab, so I couldn't buy a ticket. I wish ScotRail could read this.
